Posts.Content: I agree with Dextergirl. My cancer was small such that I had radiation and nor hormone therapy as the oncologist didn't believe my estrogen values required it----maybe being 78 and an active Silver Sneakers Circuit class attendee and walker had something to do with it. Do some exercise; it really is helpful. Exercise has kept me from having knee replacement since the leg muscles help keep the pain minimal. Not a health care worker---just an active person
Posts.Title: Still Tired Three Years After Breast Cancer Treatment

Posts.Content: Best to you Hopefully, the swelling won't be too great.
Posts.Title: Surgery on arm with lymphedena

Posts.Content: I only had a lumpectomy. I visit with the medical oncologist every 6 months and have the annual mammogram. I did learn that I have breast lymphedema so I've visited with medical staff including PT to learn about daiyl massage for it. No other tests.
Posts.Title: What diagnostic tests are done routinely post surgery and/or chemotherapy?
